confession.seduction_context: Angry that Henry Goudot had bought portion of house belonging to her daughter; she was in garden when devil appeared and promised to make her happy
sabbat_activities: beaten if orders not carried out

witnesses.name: Sebille femme Nicolas Estienne
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Was attended by accused as midwife during childbirth

testimony.quarrel_subject: First husband (Mengin Lours) quarrelled with accused; did not want Jennon to attend childbirth as midwife because she was 'une vraye sorciere'

witnesses.name: Colas Masson
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Late father Estienne Masson exchanged horse with accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Father exchanged horse with Jennon; since his was fine one she complained he had gained from deal

Share which her daughter Barbelline had in house which he bought; golden ecu he had lent her husband returned as not being 'bon liortte'; wanted garden produce from house reserved which witness refused

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after she was taken to supplice
after she was taken to supplice

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrelled 'et se chousarent tres bien' 6 years ago
testimony.threat_quote: elle parloit trop parce qu'elles se chousoient souventefois, et fut raporté a ladite depposante qu'elle dit qu'il luy falloit quelque chose

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: day or two after hair cutting incident
two and a half years before testimony

testimony.quarrel_subject: Late husband asked to borrow cart and horses to bring in grain, which they refused

witnesses.name: Claudon Crollesier dit le Grand Claudon
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Had plough-sharing arrangement with accused's husband

testimony.quarrel_subject: Plough-sharing arrangement with husband; horses were young and he did not want them 'estellé a main droite' but only 'a main gauche'
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il demeureroit bien avec eulx, et qu'il s'en ressentiroit

testimony.quarrel_subject: Repeated wife's story - refusing loan of cart
Quarrelled in fields over daughter Fleuratte's illness

witnesses.name: Mre Jean du Pont
witnesses.occupation: maire à Domjevin pour Mgr de Vaudemont

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrelled with late husband Gerardin over not putting sheep with village flock in Gerardin's care, dispute over payment; also Gerardin accused him of encroaching on boundary between meadows
testimony.threat_quote: Gerardin told him he would repent

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot
timeline.details: Additional witness testimonies; payment of 21 francs 9 gros for expenses

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; caught in lies about hair cutting incident

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confession begins under rack

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions; detailed questioning about sabbat and devil

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

accomplices_named.name: Mengin Lours
accomplices_named.context: Named during torture; saw approximately dozen others at sabbat wearing masks

prior_accusations.context: Accused her 12 years before trial (circa 1591); taken to his execution to see if he would discharge her, which he did not

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengin Lours (first husband of witness #2)
notable_quotes.context: Said when refusing to have Jennon attend his wife's childbirth as midwife

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabey femme Demenge Pierson (witness #15)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle parloit trop parce qu'elles se chousoient souventefois, et fut raporté a ladite depposante qu'elle dit qu'il luy falloit quelque chose
notable_quotes.english: that she spoke too much because they quarrelled often, and it was reported to the witness that she said she needed something [from her]
notable_quotes.context: Threat after quarrel 6 years before trial

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot (accused)
notable_quotes.context: Said to Zabey after cutting her hair and placing hand on her head

notable_quotes.speaker: Fleuratte (witness #10)
notable_quotes.french: mais au contraire qu'elle luy faisoit bonne myne et se rendit affable a elle par le conseil de ses amyes pour veoir sy elle luy osteroit ceste malladie
notable_quotes.english: but on the contrary she made a good face to her and became friendly to her by the advice of her friends to see if she would take away this illness
notable_quotes.context: Describing her strategy of being friendly to Jennon after falling ill

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Crollesier (witness #19)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il demeureroit bien avec eulx, et qu'il s'en ressentiroit
notable_quotes.english: that he would remain well with them, and that he would feel it

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne femme Colas Simon (witness #23)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle avoit desja donné le mal a sadite fille, et qu'il eust mieulx vallu qu'elle l'eust faict mourir, qu'elle l'eust plustost oublié
notable_quotes.english: that she had already given illness to her daughter, and that it would have been better if she had made her die, that she would have sooner forgotten her
notable_quotes.context: Confronting Jennon in fields about daughter's illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot (accused, response to witness #23)
notable_quotes.french: sy l'on l'avoit menée a Blamont, l'on l'avoit renvoyée femme de bien, et que dieu scavoit tout, et qu'elle estoit aussy femme de bien que ladite depposante
notable_quotes.english: if she had been taken to Blamont, she had been sent back as a good woman, and that God knew everything, and that she was as good a woman as the witness

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot (accused, under torture)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle vouldroit estre sorciere depuis six sepmaines ença affin de mieulx cognoistre ses faictz, et qu'on ne la recerche plus tant pour neant
notable_quotes.english: that she wished she had been a witch for the past six weeks in order to better know her deeds, and that they would not search her so much for nothing
notable_quotes.context: Said at outset of torture; interpreted by judges as sign of guilt

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot (accused, confession)
notable_quotes.french: estoit par la persuasion dudit Parsin son maitre, qui la provoquoit et par fois luy donnoit des soufflets pour la contraindre de donner le mal ce que touteffois elle ne faisoit trop volontiers
notable_quotes.english: it was by the persuasion of said Parsin her master, who provoked her and sometimes gave her blows to force her to give harm which however she did not do too willingly

relationships.evidence_text: Jennon femme Gerardin Friot de Domjevin
daughter of Jean Andre and his wife Catherine
daughter of Jean Andre and his wife Catherine
her daughter Barbelline had in a house
Mengin Lours had been first husband
Mengin Lours had been his son-in-law
Had been very fearful of her as neighbour
Jehenne wife of Demenge Jean Jean (now dead)

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes: Henry Goudot bought house share belonging to accused's daughter Barbelline; golden ecu lent to accused's husband returned as not being 'bon liortte'; garden produce dispute. Jean du Pont quarrelled with accused's husband Gerardin over sheep payment and meadow boundaries. Plough-sharing arrangement ended over horse harnessing preferences.

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: belonged to late father Estienne Masson
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Father exchanged horse with Jennon; since his was fine one she complained he had gained from deal and walked behind horse

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill with pains in thigh and leg, although no outward signs - still troubling her a little
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel over matter of no importance
quarrel over share which daughter Barbelline had in house which he bought, and over golden ecu lent to husband, and garden produce
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after she was taken to supplice

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel over share which daughter Barbelline had in house which he bought, and over golden ecu lent to husband, and garden produce
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after she was taken to supplice

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, lost child she was carrying (conceived 5 weeks earlier), arms became all twisted below elbow
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrelled 6 years ago; later hair cutting incident at poisle
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cutting hair and placing hand on head; later confessed to using powder on her hand

harms_catalog.harm_description: dog had something in throat, could not bark, rolled around, died after 5 or 6 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused's pig allegedly died strangled by his dog
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: about two and a half years before testimony

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: belonged to Zabel and Colas Claudat
harms_catalog.harm_description: horse became ill on way to fields, very difficult to get back, in stable was 'merveilleusement farouche' before dying
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: late husband asked to borrow cart and horses to bring in grain, which they refused
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: shortly afterwards, same day they agreed to take 'garderobe' to her daughter
harms_catalog.method_alleged: proximity - asked them to take clothes to daughter

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost two horses after they were ill for 2 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: plough-sharing arrangement ended because they would not harness horses as he wished

harms_catalog.harm_description: wife taken with sudden illness, dying after 3 weeks; she said it was 'd'art sortilegique'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrelled with late husband Gerardin over sheep payment and meadow boundary encroachment; witness told Gerardin he did not fear damage although his wife was a witch

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: belonged to parents of Henry Goudat le jeune
harms_catalog.harm_description: sow broke into place where pears were drying and ate them, dying next day
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: sow ate pears accused had brought to be dried in oven

material_culture.context: Late husband of Zabel and Colas Claudat asked to borrow cart and horses to bring in grain
Multiple horses involved in exchanges, plough-sharing, transportation; several died
Accused asked to have clothes taken to her daughter who was working for witness
Lent to accused's husband but returned as not being 'bon liortte'
Brought to be dried in oven at Henry Goudat's father's house; sow ate them and died
Used to harm Zabey femme Demenge Pierson
Used to cure Zabey femme Demenge Pierson
Women threw on fire at poisle to make bad smell and force other group to leave
Fleuratte allegedly fell off plank while carrying manure
Fleuratte was carrying manure when she allegedly fell

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and most witnesses
Location where accused was taken for confrontation with Mengin Lours 12 years before; sent back as 'femme de bien'
Location of sabbat attended by accused
Where accused was when devil appeared to seduce her; also dispute over garden produce
Multiple references: where horses became ill, where Jehenne confronted accused about daughter's illness, where quarrels over meadow boundaries occurred
Winter gathering place for women; site of hair cutting incident
Location of Change de Nancy court that approved torture and death sentence
Place where accused was taken (place of execution/interrogation)

economic_hardship_indicators: disputes over payment for services (sheep care)

legal_context.redress_outcome: Taken to Blamont 12 years earlier for confrontation with Mengin Lours; sent back as 'femme de bien' (good woman)

hearsay_chains.content: Jennon told mother that Fleuratte was ill after disputing with her
It was reported that Jennon said 'il luy falloit quelque chose' (she needed something from her)
Other persons told her that accused had said she would have something

emotional_state_notes: responded maliciously and with pertinacity during confrontations
said she did not harm animals too willingly, was forced by devil with blows

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said to Zabey femme Colas Claudat that her daughter having dispute with witness told her that her mother had caused horse to die
Denied cutting Zabey's hair; said she had not gone with women to poisle
Said Fleuratte had injured herself by falling off plank while carrying manure
Replied that Chrestienne had confessed to making Zabey ill (before being asked about it)

third_parties.name: Mengin Lours
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: Accused her 12 years earlier; she deposed against him
third_parties.context: Executed witch who had accused Jennon; was first husband of witness Sebille

third_parties.name: Chrestienne femme Jean Diez
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: Recently executed witch who had accused Jennon

third_parties.name: Estienne Masson
third_parties.context: Exchanged horse with accused; horse died shortly after

third_parties.name: Barbelline
third_parties.context: Had share in house that Henry Goudot bought, leading to quarrel

third_parties.name: Gerardin Friot
third_parties.context: Had quarrel with Jean du Pont over sheep payment and meadow boundaries; was 'paistre des bestes a cornes'

third_parties.name: Jehenne wife of Demenge Jean Jean
third_parties.context: Taught them method to identify who had given illness; now dead

third_parties.name: wife of Jean du Pont
third_parties.context: Died after 3 weeks of sudden illness; said it was 'd'art sortilegique'

third_parties.name: midwife of Dompgevin
third_parties.context: Was ill and unable to attend Sebille's childbirth, so asked Jennon to stand in

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed witness testimonies, torture interrogation, and confession. Trial began with informations preparatoires based on 12-year-old reputation stemming from accusation by Mengin Lours (already executed). Key incident involved hair-cutting at poisle leading to illness of Zabey femme Demenge Pierson. Accused initially denied charges but confessed under torture (rack). Named only already-executed accomplices. Multiple animal deaths (horses, pigs, dog) and one human death. Executed October 15, 1603. Notable pattern of accused being friendly/helpful (midwife, curing illness) then suspected of harm.
